title: A BBC Leader Quits Over a Big Problem
summary: A former BBC board member named Shumeet Banerji quit his job and shared a letter explaining why. He said he was not included in important talks about a news boss named Deborah Turness. The BBC chair, Samir Shah, thought he had talked to Banerji, but Banerji disagrees. This all started because of a TV show about Donald Trump that caused trouble. People are worried about how the BBC board makes decisions. Banerji did not want to be part of a decision he was not asked about. This story shows a disagreement between leaders at the BBC.

background_read: The BBC is a big news company in the UK. A board helps make decisions for it. Sometimes, leaders disagree on how things are done. In this case, a TV show caused problems, and a board member felt left out of talks. This is important because it shows how organizations handle disagreements and make fair decisions.
